content.question: Scientists set up an experiment as shown above. Charged particles of mass <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and charge <math alttext="q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are emitted from a source and initially move with a constant velocity, <math alttext="v" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The scientists wish to temporarily confine the particles in a uniform magnetic field, <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The region of the magnetic field has a horizontal range <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. To confine the particles, the scientists switch on the magnetic field at the moment when the particles reach the center of its horizontal range. Which of the following is a correct prediction of the results of the experiment?

choices.label: If the scientists set <math alttext="B is greater than, the fraction with numerator 2 m v, and denominator q x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mi>B</mi><mo>></mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>q</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> , then the particle will be confined to the field.

If the scientists set <math alttext="B is greater than, the fraction with numerator 2 m v, and denominator q x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi><mo>></mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>q</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> , then the particle will not be confined to the field.

If the scientists set <math alttext="B is greater than, the fraction with numerator m v, and denominator q x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi><mo>></mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>q</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> , then the particle will be confined to the field.
